Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: Gunfighters
programme.desc: In Texas, gunfighter Brazos Kane (Randolph Scott) decides to lay down his guns for good and rides out to visit his best friend -- only to witness his murder. When Brazos takes the body to the nearby ranch of the powerful Banner (Griff Barnett), the rancher accuses him of the murder. Brazos leaves Banner's daughter, Bess (Barbara Britton), a vital piece of evidence in the crime, and then must evade Banner and a crooked sheriff as he reluctantly takes up arms to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt and Festus lend money to a strapped farmer, then he loses it in a poker game.

programme.title: The Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Jim Kipp (Randolph Scott) is a bounty hunter hired to find three robbers who committed a daring heist three years ago. When he arrives in a small town near the robbery, he senses that the thieves may be living there. However, many of the townspeople -- including Dr. Spencer (Harry Antrim), his daughter, Julie (Dolores Dorn), and barmaid Alice (Marie Windsor) -- are put on edge by Kipp's presence and want him gone. Kipp perseveres, hatching a plan that he thinks will draw out the bandits.

programme.title: Frontier Marshal
programme.desc: In the frontier town of Tombstone, Arizona, the charismatic Wyatt Earp (Randolph Scott) is a pistol-toting sheriff who earns the respect of almost everyone he encounters. John "Doc" Halliday (Cesar Romero), however, poses an unusual challenge to the lawman when he flouts local rules with his illegal business ventures. But the sheriff finds himself acting on Halliday's behalf when the latter is slain, leading to the famed gun battle at the O.K. Corral.

programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Proficient in TV trivia? Can't get your fill of the latest in pop culture? This series combines both by opening the floor to a team of television aficionados, engaging them in a lively discussion regarding a classic TV topic, then counting down viewers' favorite shows and/or characters within that genre. There's a unique twist involved too.

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: "Chain Reaction" is back with fan-favorite Dylan Lane returning as host of the popular word puzzle game in which players compete to form chains composed of two-word phrases.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices, and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Actor Alec Baldwin hosts - and executive produces - the newest iteration of the iconic panel game show in which four contestants try to match answers given by six celebrities to humorous and often risque fill-in-the-blank questions. The famous panelists range from quick-witted comics to stars of the stage and screen.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices, and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Proficient in TV trivia? Can't get your fill of the latest in pop culture? This series combines both by opening the floor to a team of television aficionados, engaging them in a lively discussion regarding a classic TV topic, then counting down viewers' favorite shows and/or characters within that genre. There's a unique twist involved too.

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: "Chain Reaction" is back with fan-favorite Dylan Lane returning as host of the popular word puzzle game in which players compete to form chains composed of two-word phrases.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices, and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Actor Alec Baldwin hosts - and executive produces - the newest iteration of the iconic panel game show in which four contestants try to match answers given by six celebrities to humorous and often risque fill-in-the-blank questions. The famous panelists range from quick-witted comics to stars of the stage and screen.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices, and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.desc: In this week's lesson, we explore God's passionate and compassionate nature, emphasizing His emotional depth and love for humanity. Despite human unfaithfulness, God's love is enduring and visceral, as seen in Christ's compassion during His ministry. Divine jealousy is understood as righteous passion, seeking an exclusive relationship withHispeople.

programme.title: 3ABN Sabbath School Panel
programme.desc: In this week's lesson, we explore God's passionate and compassionate nature, emphasizing His emotional depth and love for humanity. The Bible portrays God's love as far surpassing human love, using parental imagery to highlight His unwavering compassion (Isa. 49:15, Hos. 11:1-9). Despite human unfaithfulness, God's love is enduring and visceral, as seen in Christ's compassion during His ministry. Divine jealousy is understood as righteous passion, seeking an exclusive relationship withHispeople.

programme.title: On Second Street
programme.desc: A public affairs program bringing awareness to and discussing public policy issues that impact everyday Canadians from coast-to-coast.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave
programme.desc: A boy enchanted with tales from the Old West unlocks a mystery that could save their family farm. While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. A bond with the boy grows as the drifter recounts breathtaking stories of Shooter Green, a legendary gunslinger accused of Arizona's biggest gold robbery. The truth is revealed, along with the secret of the drifter's past when a crooked lawman appears, hot on the trail of the stolen gold. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. Stars Adam Baldwin (The Last Ship, Full Metal Jacket, The Patriot), Jeremy Sumpter (Peter Pan, Soul Surfer), Jill Wagner (Braven, Christmas Cookies), and Jet Jurgensmeyer (Last Man Standing, American Sniper).

programme.title: The Last Days of Frank and Jesse James
programme.desc: When the famous James brothers give up robbing banks and attempt to live as reputable gentleman farmers, they are soon forced to seek revenge on the men who bomb their mother's house, crippling her, and killing their stepbrother.

programme.title: Once Upon a Texas Train
programme.desc: An outlaw and a Texas Ranger have a life-long personal feud, but now, as grumpy older men, they must put their differences aside and face a common problem - a young gang of outlaws ravaging Texas.

programme.title: War of the Wildcats
programme.desc: During the early days of the Oklahoma oil boom, a greedy, self-assured oilman and a quiet, yet determined cowboy fight for the rights to oil on Indian land. All the while a pretty schoolteacher steals both men's hearts.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E16 Daddy's Girl There is a new girl in Sweetwater, and she has eyes for Buck. However, Buck must contend with her rich, oppressive father. Meanwhile, the riders help a woman in need after the corrupt banker's henchmen kill her husband.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E10 Jim Roberts Cleans Up Jerome In his first week on the job as the new constable of Jerome, Arizona, Jim Roberts gets to work arresting the town's troublemakers and teaching his timid deputy how to be a courageous lawman as they track down a stone-cold killer and his gang.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E9 Last Shot at the OK Corral In an odd twist of fate, photographers C.S. and Mollie Fly decide to open a studio next to a dusty corral in Tombstone, Arizona, and they end up taking the last shot of the Old West's most infamous gunbattle, the Shootout at the O.K. Corral.

programme.title: Legends of the Pony Express
programme.desc: Heroic Pony Express riders and station keepers face deadly terrain, hostile Native Americans, and dangerous outlaws to deliver vital mail across the untamed frontier. Their life-and-death adventures unite the country and become the stuff of legends.

programme.title: The Legend of 5 Mile Cave
programme.desc: A boy enchanted with tales from the Old West unlocks a mystery that could save their family farm. While his widowed mother struggles to avoid foreclosure, a mysterious stranger arrives looking for a room to rent. A bond with the boy grows as the drifter recounts breathtaking stories of Shooter Green, a legendary gunslinger accused of Arizona's biggest gold robbery. The truth is revealed, along with the secret of the drifter's past when a crooked lawman appears, hot on the trail of the stolen gold. Past and present collide in this tale of action, adventure and drama. Stars Adam Baldwin (The Last Ship, Full Metal Jacket, The Patriot), Jeremy Sumpter (Peter Pan, Soul Surfer), Jill Wagner (Braven, Christmas Cookies), and Jet Jurgensmeyer (Last Man Standing, American Sniper).

programme.title: The Last Days of Frank and Jesse James
programme.desc: When the famous James brothers give up robbing banks and attempt to live as reputable gentleman farmers, they are soon forced to seek revenge on the men who bomb their mother's house, crippling her, and killing their stepbrother.

programme.title: Once Upon a Texas Train
programme.desc: An outlaw and a Texas Ranger have a life-long personal feud, but now, as grumpy older men, they must put their differences aside and face a common problem - a young gang of outlaws ravaging Texas.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E1 Big Deal The guys are back in the saddle on The Cowboy Way! Their dreams of making it big have finally arrived with a million-dollar business opportunity, but only if they can come up with half the cash. While the cowboys struggle with how to raise the money, Bubba is torn if he should ask his father-in-law for help. Booger teaches Matthew to be a real cowboy and gives him his first pony! But when Jaclyn misses this big milestone, she questions if her demanding job is keeping her from her family. And finally, Cody’s mission to teach kids about the importance of ranching leads him to take on the Cattlemen’s Association. How far will he go to make his point?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E2 New Sheriff in Town It’s back to basics on The Cowboy Way as the guys work to rotate cattle off a lightning-struck field to fresh grass, but the routine wrangle suddenly heads south as the herd scatters, jumping and taking down part of a fence. Kaley wonders about finances and if she should find work, while Bubba invests in a starter herd for daughter Andie’s Cowgirl College Fund. Jaclyn rushes to prepare for Matthew’s 4th birthday party and anxiously waits for news after a job interview. Booger’s parents have a special birthday surprise for Matthew. As the Cattlemen’s Association Ambassador, Cody gets a call from a local farmer and meets their autistic son Tristan. Misty gives Cody an idea how to share the cowboy way lifestyle with this special boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E23 The Lost Treasure of Canyon Town On the way home to North Fork, Lucas, Micah, and Mark take a detour to Micah's hometown. A thriving mining town years ago, it is now a ghost town except for Mr. Newman and his son who still live there. Something is amiss, and a mystery is revealed.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E24 Dark Day at North Fork While hauling dynamite, Lucas accidentally creates a spark, leading to an explosion. He is blinded and Doc Burrage isn't sure if he will regain his sight. When an enemy from Lucas' past shows up in town, he is in danger, as the man aims to kill him.

programme.title: Only the Valiant
programme.desc: A cavalry officer is blamed by his men and his lady for the death of a popular officer. Now, he must find a way to stop an Indian attack on their fort. It might prove to be the only way to regain the trust of his men and the affection of his woman.

programme.title: Rage at Dawn
programme.desc: In 1866, the Reno Brothers gang is ravaging Indiana. When a detective agency sends a man to infiltrate the gang by posing as an outlaw, he sets a trap to capture the gang during an early-morning train robbery.

programme.title: Handcrafted America
programme.desc: S1 E14 Dad's Favorites Host Jill Wagner travels the country to find artisans who make handcrafted products that appeal to men. For the hunting and fishing type, Jill showcases the work of a husband and wife team that forges knives in remote Alaska, an Oregon craftsman who makes traditional bamboo fly fishing rods, and a North Carolina gunsmith who makes authentic flintlock long rifles. For sports fans, Jill heads to New Jersey to visit a leatherworker who makes vintage baseballs and footballs from exotic leathers. And for men who enjoy one-of-a-kind items, Jill highlights artisans who make pens from scraps of wood and furniture from discarded whiskey barrels.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E7 The Assailants When Senator Jim Borden visits North Fork, Marshal Micah Torrance receives a telegram stating an assassination attempt could be made on the senator's life. The plot begins to unfold as four gunman disguised as cavalrymen arrive with a Gatling gun.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E8 Mark's Rifle Marty Blair rides into North Fork to promote a circus coming out west from Ohio. Blair is soon under suspicion when there is an attempted robbery at the hotel. Mark finds it hard to believe that Blair is guilty, however, Lucas feels differently.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Most Amazing Man Wade Randall comes to North Fork and mesmerizes children with big stories of his past gun battles with outlaws. Lucas suspects he is all talk and exposes the truth after Randall refuses to accept a shootout challenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E10 Squeeze Play A land speculator named Willard Prescott contacts Lucas about buying his land as the railroad is fast approaching the area. He bribes Lucas and when he refuses, Prescott makes it clear he will stop at nothing to get his land, one way or the other.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E8 The Return of Mr. Grimm During an arrest, Cheyenne shoots and kills the lawless son of Nathanael Grimm, a wealthy man who controls the town. Cheyenne faces a murder charge, and the townspeople are out of work when Grimm closes his mine in revenge.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Beholden Cheyenne arrives in Winslow with a letter recommending him for the marshal's job. As he delivers it to the banker the next morning, Elijah McGuire and his men rob the bank, and Cheyenne finds himself caught in the middle.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E1 Big Deal The guys are back in the saddle on The Cowboy Way! Their dreams of making it big have finally arrived with a million-dollar business opportunity, but only if they can come up with half the cash. While the cowboys struggle with how to raise the money, Bubba is torn if he should ask his father-in-law for help. Booger teaches Matthew to be a real cowboy and gives him his first pony! But when Jaclyn misses this big milestone, she questions if her demanding job is keeping her from her family. And finally, Cody’s mission to teach kids about the importance of ranching leads him to take on the Cattlemen’s Association. How far will he go to make his point?

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E2 New Sheriff in Town It’s back to basics on The Cowboy Way as the guys work to rotate cattle off a lightning-struck field to fresh grass, but the routine wrangle suddenly heads south as the herd scatters, jumping and taking down part of a fence. Kaley wonders about finances and if she should find work, while Bubba invests in a starter herd for daughter Andie’s Cowgirl College Fund. Jaclyn rushes to prepare for Matthew’s 4th birthday party and anxiously waits for news after a job interview. Booger’s parents have a special birthday surprise for Matthew. As the Cattlemen’s Association Ambassador, Cody gets a call from a local farmer and meets their autistic son Tristan. Misty gives Cody an idea how to share the cowboy way lifestyle with this special boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E23 The Lost Treasure of Canyon Town On the way home to North Fork, Lucas, Micah, and Mark take a detour to Micah's hometown. A thriving mining town years ago, it is now a ghost town except for Mr. Newman and his son who still live there. Something is amiss, and a mystery is revealed.

programme.desc: S5 E8 Mark's Rifle Marty Blair rides into North Fork to promote a circus coming out west from Ohio. Blair is soon under suspicion when there is an attempted robbery at the hotel. Mark finds it hard to believe that Blair is guilty, however, Lucas feels differently.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Most Amazing Man Wade Randall comes to North Fork and mesmerizes children with big stories of his past gun battles with outlaws. Lucas suspects he is all talk and exposes the truth after Randall refuses to accept a shootout challenge.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E10 Squeeze Play A land speculator named Willard Prescott contacts Lucas about buying his land as the railroad is fast approaching the area. He bribes Lucas and when he refuses, Prescott makes it clear he will stop at nothing to get his land, one way or the other.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E8 The Return of Mr. Grimm During an arrest, Cheyenne shoots and kills the lawless son of Nathanael Grimm, a wealthy man who controls the town. Cheyenne faces a murder charge, and the townspeople are out of work when Grimm closes his mine in revenge.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E9 The Beholden Cheyenne arrives in Winslow with a letter recommending him for the marshal's job. As he delivers it to the banker the next morning, Elijah McGuire and his men rob the bank, and Cheyenne finds himself caught in the middle.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: These guys can wrangle any bull, but can they tame a wild bulldozer? In this episode of The Cowboy Way, the guys decide to build a new barn for a local rancher but it’s man versus machine when Bubba’s dozer breaks a pipeline, releasing a torrent of water. Jaclyn admits to her boss she’s been looking for a job closer to home, then worries it might get her fired altogether. Will her family have to survive on one income? Cody decides to write a book about the cowboy way of life, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew. The cowboys struggle to get the barn raised in time to process the first shipment of the herd and might have to call in some favors to do it.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: S4 E4 Keep on Chuckin' It’s The Cowboy Way’s first road trip ever! Bubba, Cody and Booger cut loose and head north to enter a big chuck wagon race. But they quickly discover this race is not for amateurs. Loose wagon wheels, knee-deep mud and professional-grade competition raise both the stakes, and their concerns. Will the guys risk life and limb to race and win? And while the cowboys are away, a surprise shipment of cattle comes in days early and their wives must jump into action. But this drop off is anything but routine when Kaley and Misty discover one heifer has an infection that could threaten the entire herd.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E25 The Prisoner When two ex-Confederate officers come to town, trouble ensues for Lucas as he was a lieutenant in the 8th Indiana which defeated the 12th Cavalry 15 years ago. The beaten men were sent to a Union prison camp and now want revenge on Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E26 Assault Traveling salesman Speed Sullivan, and his son, Swifty, come to North Fork selling lightning rods. Sullivan makes a call at Vashti Croxton's home where he finds her unconscious. When she blames Sullivan for the assault, Lucas must intervene.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Ultimate Cowboy Country music icon, Trace Adkins, hosts INSP’s first competition show, Ultimate Cowboy Showdown. Twelve real working cowboys from all walks of life lock horns for a prize that could change their lives. As the contestants get settled in on a cattle ranch, friendships form and tensions rise between them. Things heat up between two of the competitors when a cowboy feels disrespected. In the first challenge, the cowboys are split up into two teams where they must sort their own team’s cattle out of a mixed herd. Trace welcomes two expert cattlemen to help judge their performances. In the end, Trace sends two contestants packing, leaving only ten cowboys standing.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E6 Bass Reeves: Trailblazing Lawman After escaping the bonds of slavery, Bass Reeves takes refuge among the indigenous people of The Indian Territory, where he is welcomed into their culture. When the Civil War ends, his new-found tracking skills and fluency in native languages lead to his appointment as the first Black Deputy U.S. Marshal west of the Mississippi River. Though he faces discrimination from his peers, Reeves earns their respect when he accepts Judge Isaac Parker’s daunting order to hunt down one of the most ruthless killers in The Indian Territory and bring him back dead or alive. Some years later, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews Judge Parker to learn more about the amazing career of Bass Reeves, who goes on to arrest 3,000 felons, kill 14 men in self-defense, and complete 32 years of service without being wounded.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E7 Wild Bill Hickok & the First Quick-Draw Duel Wild Bill Hickok and his buddy, Davis Tutt, see their friendship fall apart over gambling debts and the affections of a beautiful woman. After Tutt swipes Wild Bill’s prized timepiece as payback for a disputed debt, things begin to heat up. Then, when Tutt parades through town with the watch in one hand and Hickok’s former girlfriend in the other, Wild Bill’s blood begins to boil. Tutt refuses to return the watch, and he continues to flaunt the beautiful woman on his arm. The two men meet in the middle of town to settle their differences once and for all in what will become the very first quick-draw duel of the Old West. Both men reach for their pistols at the same time and fire! In an attempt to separate the truth from the fiction, Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, interviews George Ward Nichols, the journalist who immortalized the duel and created the legend of Wild Bill Hickok.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E2 Jim Beckwourth: The Long Ride Jim Beckwourth lives a life of adventure as a trapper, trader and adopted member of the Crow tribe. When America goes to war, Beckwourth becomes an army dispatch rider, a job that puts him and a young greenhorn on a collision course with the Pawnee.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E3 Jim Baker: A Born Leader Heading west as a young adventurer, greenhorn Jim Baker quickly develops a reputation as a skilled marksman and mountain man. When a party of trappers is surrounded and attacked by Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors, Baker proves that he is also a leader.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E7 Blood Money The Kid captures a murder suspect and brings him back to town. However, suspicions arise when the man hangs himself while in the custody of a corrupt marshal. The riders and family of the dead man are determined to find out the truth.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E11 Gun Shy After one of Mark's friends dies due to a shooting accident, he is totally against his father having a rifle. Lucas explains in vain the need for a rifle on the frontier, leading to Mark running away. Meanwhile, Lou has problems with a wanted outlaw.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E12 The Anvil Chorus North Fork's blacksmith, Nils Swenson, volunteers to fill in for Marshal Micah Torrance while he is out of town. To keep the peace, Nils starts a policy that everyone turns in their gun upon entry to the town. His plan backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E13 Conflict While hunting, Lucas misses an easy shot at a cougar just a few feet away, and seconds from attacking Mark. After discovering that his gun is not the problem, Lucas begins to doubt his abilities with a rifle, leading him to do some soul-searching.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E14 Incident at Line Shack Six Railroad boss John Gangling runs an operation at Line Shack Six. Gangling pays his men in gold and when he finds that Charlie Been saves his wages in a money belt, he kills him for it. An innocent Indian who happens to stop by is accused of murder.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E10 The Frightened Town A gang of disorderly cowhands take over the town of Kingsburg. Fear grips the townspeople. The men try to create a disturbance to cover up a bank robbery. Cheyenne, who is traveling with them, steps in to support the marshal.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E11 Lone Patrol Cheyenne scouts for Army troops one last time to deliver supplies to Fort Burnside with both inexperienced Captain Duquesne and Trooper Daily. The captain dismisses Cheyenne's concerns over the Shoshone, who later attack them.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: These guys can wrangle any bull, but can they tame a wild bulldozer? In this episode of The Cowboy Way, the guys decide to build a new barn for a local rancher but it’s man versus machine when Bubba’s dozer breaks a pipeline, releasing a torrent of water. programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E11 Lone Patrol Cheyenne scouts for Army troops one last time to deliver supplies to Fort Burnside with both inexperienced Captain Duquesne and Trooper Daily. The captain dismisses Cheyenne's concerns over the Shoshone, who later attack them.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: Booger goes back to school! On this episode of The Cowboy Way, the cowboys visit the Montgomery Stockyard to research cattle prices and Booger gets bitten by the auctioneering bug. Will his auctioneering classes pay off? Back at the ranch, the guys catch heat from a neighbor when their herd escapes into his field, and a rebellious heifer takes them on one heck of a ride. Misty’s brother-in-law, Chip, stops by and gives Cody an earful that his feeding pasture has turned to dirt. And when the cattle stock market takes a nosedive, the cowboys’ million-dollar business partner calls the gang into his office for a tough talk.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: The cowboys head west to Louisiana in this episode of The Cowboy Way! The boys hit the road to find the perfect bull for their herd, if Booger’s backseat antics don’t drive them all crazy first. They discover a ‘cowboy candy store’ where a famous saddle maker fits Bubba’s horse for a custom saddle. Cody gets challenged to a roping contest by some teenagers. And when they accidentally find themselves in the fanciest restaurant in town, the guys test their cowboy palate with fine French cuisine. Escargot anyone? Back home Jaclyn and Kaley try hot yoga for their first and maybe last time, and Misty takes a shine to modeling.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E27 Short Rope for a Tall Man Lucas and Mark travel to a nearby town to sell a bull. While in town, they buy two horses from Mr. Schneider, a man in a hurry. When a posse stops Lucas and Mark on the way home, Lucas learns the horses were stolen. The men want Lucas to hang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E28 The Clarence Bibs Story Clarence Bibs, a simple-minded man, fancies himself as a gunfighter. While practicing, he falls and his gun fires, killing a famous gunslinger. The man's partner comes to town wanting revenge.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Weakest Link World champion tie-down roper, Fred Whitfield, joins Trace Adkins to judge the cowboys as they compete in an individual calf-roping challenge. The contestant who ropes the fastest time wins immunity from the next elimination. Tensions continue to build between two of the competitors until one reaches his breaking point, and things get physical. A team challenge puts the cowboys' skills to the test. Trace wonders if some of them have the experience needed to compete at this level. The two contestants who fall short hit the trail, leaving eight cowboys remaining.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E8 Dr. Susan Anderson: Frontier Medicine Woman Freshly-graduated from medical school, Dr. Susan Anderson sets up a practice in Cripple Creek, Colorado, a rough-and-tumble mining town. At a time when only ten percent of physicians are female, Dr. Anderson faces her share of doubters and has a difficult time attracting patients in the frontier town. When miners suddenly rush into her office with an injured boy, she defies prevailing wisdom and decides to save his mangled arm instead of amputating the limb. The risks are enormous. If the boy’s arm becomes infected, and he dies, she will lose everything. Years later, Dr. Anderson relives the story while treating Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, who comes down with fever while passing through Cripple Creek.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E9 Elfego Baca & the Frisco Shootout Just days on the job and brandishing a homemade badge, nineteen-year-old Deputy Elfego Baca’s courage is immediately put to the test. After arresting a drunken cowboy for shooting up a saloon, Baca faces down the cowboy’s friends, who are hired guns for a wealthy rancher. He wins the first skirmish, but the cowboys return with reinforcements and the stage is set for the biggest and longest gunfight in Old West history. Baca seeks shelter in a small adobe house and makes his stand against a small army of men who shoot up the house with thousands of rounds of ammunition over the course of 33 hours. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson gets the real story of what comes to be known as the Frisco Shootout from the former sheriff who deputized Baca just prior to the legendary gun battle.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E4 Lucien Maxwell: Legend of New Mexico Having explored the frontier with his good friend Kit Carson, Lucien Maxwell is eager to settle down with his family. But before he can establish a ranching empire in New Mexico, Maxwell must first survive a deadly clash with the Jicarilla Apache.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E5 Bill Hamilton: The Last Mountain Man Coming of age on the frontier, young Bill Hamilton joins Old Bill Williams on an epic adventure during the final days of the fur trade. The last true mountain man, Hamilton's courage is tested when he faces an epic showdown with Bannock warriors.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E8 Requiem for a Hero Cody meets his Western idol, Hezekiah Horn, a writer who is disgusted with the violence of the Indian police and the development of the West. Meanwhile, an unfortunate chain of events creates tragedy for Horn and his son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E15 Suspicion Lucas and Mark find Winslow Quince stranded in the desert with a broken wagon wheel. They stop to help, and when they get to North Fork with Quince, many note his gold coin purchases and lavish gifts. Lucas is suspicious, and townsfolk want answers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E16 The Sidewinder Gridley Maule comes to North Fork with revenge on his mind and confronts Lucas, who shot and killed his father years ago during a bank robbery. When Gridley tries to get Mark to fight, Micah puts him in jail, and Lou steps in to reform the young boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E18 Hostages to Fortune On Halloween, Mark and his friends wear masks and go from ranch to ranch to play pranks. Knowing the boys will be blamed, rustlers wear similar masks to steal cattle. Lucas thinks the boys are mixed up in the theft, until he finds out the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E12 Massacre at Gunsight Pass Cheyenne travels on a stagecoach to deliver prisoner Johnny Eldorado to Fort Bridger. When an arrogant Russian passenger shoots and kills a Shoshone brave on the way, they must hurry to a relay station to find safety.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E13 The Greater Glory A woman who endures many hardships but maintains her strong faith in God impresses Cheyenne. With her husband wounded and unable to work, Cheyenne, and Billy the Kid, join forces to help her drive her herd of cattle 50 miles.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: Booger goes back to school! On this episode of The Cowboy Way, the cowboys visit the Montgomery Stockyard to research cattle prices and Booger gets bitten by the auctioneering bug. Will his auctioneering classes pay off? Back at the ranch, the guys catch heat from a neighbor when their herd escapes into his field, and a rebellious heifer takes them on one heck of a ride. Misty’s brother-in-law, Chip, stops by and gives Cody an earful that his feeding pasture has turned to dirt. And when the cattle stock market takes a nosedive, the cowboys’ million-dollar business partner calls the gang into his office for a tough talk.

The boys hit the road to find the perfect bull for their herd, if Booger’s backseat antics don’t drive them all crazy first. They discover a ‘cowboy candy store’ where a famous saddle maker fits Bubba’s horse for a custom saddle. Cody gets challenged to a roping contest by some teenagers. And when they accidentally find themselves in the fanciest restaurant in town, the guys test their cowboy palate with fine French cuisine. Escargot anyone? Back home Jaclyn and Kaley try hot yoga for their first and maybe last time, and Misty takes a shine to modeling.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E27 Short Rope for a Tall Man Lucas and Mark travel to a nearby town to sell a bull. While in town, they buy two horses from Mr. Schneider, a man in a hurry. When a posse stops Lucas and Mark on the way home, Lucas learns the horses were stolen. The men want Lucas to hang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E28 The Clarence Bibs Story Clarence Bibs, a simple-minded man, fancies himself as a gunfighter. While practicing, he falls and his gun fires, killing a famous gunslinger. The man's partner comes to town wanting revenge.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Weakest Link World champion tie-down roper, Fred Whitfield, joins Trace Adkins to judge the cowboys as they compete in an individual calf-roping challenge. The contestant who ropes the fastest time wins immunity from the next elimination. Tensions continue to build between two of the competitors until one reaches his breaking point, and things get physical. A team challenge puts the cowboys' skills to the test. Trace wonders if some of them have the experience needed to compete at this level. The two contestants who fall short hit the trail, leaving eight cowboys remaining.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E8 Dr. Susan Anderson: Frontier Medicine Woman Freshly-graduated from medical school, Dr. Susan Anderson sets up a practice in Cripple Creek, Colorado, a rough-and-tumble mining town. At a time when only ten percent of physicians are female, Dr. Anderson faces her share of doubters and has a difficult time attracting patients in the frontier town. When miners suddenly rush into her office with an injured boy, she defies prevailing wisdom and decides to save his mangled arm instead of amputating the limb. The risks are enormous. If the boy’s arm becomes infected, and he dies, she will lose everything. Years later, Dr. Anderson relives the story while treating Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, who comes down with fever while passing through Cripple Creek.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E9 Elfego Baca & the Frisco Shootout Just days on the job and brandishing a homemade badge, nineteen-year-old Deputy Elfego Baca’s courage is immediately put to the test. After arresting a drunken cowboy for shooting up a saloon, Baca faces down the cowboy’s friends, who are hired guns for a wealthy rancher. He wins the first skirmish, but the cowboys return with reinforcements and the stage is set for the biggest and longest gunfight in Old West history. Baca seeks shelter in a small adobe house and makes his stand against a small army of men who shoot up the house with thousands of rounds of ammunition over the course of 33 hours. Years later, legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson gets the real story of what comes to be known as the Frisco Shootout from the former sheriff who deputized Baca just prior to the legendary gun battle.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E4 Lucien Maxwell: Legend of New Mexico Having explored the frontier with his good friend Kit Carson, Lucien Maxwell is eager to settle down with his family. But before he can establish a ranching empire in New Mexico, Maxwell must first survive a deadly clash with the Jicarilla Apache.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E5 Bill Hamilton: The Last Mountain Man Coming of age on the frontier, young Bill Hamilton joins Old Bill Williams on an epic adventure during the final days of the fur trade. The last true mountain man, Hamilton's courage is tested when he faces an epic showdown with Bannock warriors.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E8 Requiem for a Hero Cody meets his Western idol, Hezekiah Horn, a writer who is disgusted with the violence of the Indian police and the development of the West. Meanwhile, an unfortunate chain of events creates tragedy for Horn and his son.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E15 Suspicion Lucas and Mark find Winslow Quince stranded in the desert with a broken wagon wheel. They stop to help, and when they get to North Fork with Quince, many note his gold coin purchases and lavish gifts. Lucas is suspicious, and townsfolk want answers.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E16 The Sidewinder Gridley Maule comes to North Fork with revenge on his mind and confronts Lucas, who shot and killed his father years ago during a bank robbery. When Gridley tries to get Mark to fight, Micah puts him in jail, and Lou steps in to reform the young boy.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E17 The Sixteenth Cousin The big day finally arrives in North Fork as the first train comes to town. Onboard are Lucas and Mark along with a Japanese nobleman and his servant. When bullies harass the foreign visitors, the pair quickly teaches them a lesson in good manners.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E18 Hostages to Fortune On Halloween, Mark and his friends wear masks and go from ranch to ranch to play pranks. Knowing the boys will be blamed, rustlers wear similar masks to steal cattle. Lucas thinks the boys are mixed up in the theft, until he finds out the truth.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E12 Massacre at Gunsight Pass Cheyenne travels on a stagecoach to deliver prisoner Johnny Eldorado to Fort Bridger. When an arrogant Russian passenger shoots and kills a Shoshone brave on the way, they must hurry to a relay station to find safety.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S5 E13 The Greater Glory A woman who endures many hardships but maintains her strong faith in God impresses Cheyenne. With her husband wounded and unable to work, Cheyenne, and Billy the Kid, join forces to help her drive her herd of cattle 50 miles.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: On this episode of The Cowboy Way, the road trip concludes as the cowboys learn how to round up cattle Louisiana-style. The guys jump into airboats and dodge gators to move a herd out of a marsh. Back home, Cody brings the boys to the Montgomery History Museum to do some family research, and discovers Bubba shares the same last name as Booger’s mother! Are Booger and Bubba... related? When Jaclyn signs Matthew up for tee-ball, Booger jumps in to coach — and discovers it’s probably easier herding cattle than 4-year olds. Kaley and Bubba get the whole gang together for a much-needed day of family fun at the lake.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way
programme.desc: It’s a high-flying episode of The Cowboy Way. Misty surprises Cody with the gift of a thrilling ride on an aerobatic glider -- only problem is, Cody is terrified of heights! Back on solid ground, some of the herd escapes into a neighboring trailer park. Can the guys wrangle them in before they do any real damage? Jaclyn starts the search for a new family home, but a rough dirt-road stands between them and their dream house. And it’s down to the wire for the cowboys’ cattle deal as the guys try to find a buyer before their million-dollar herd runs out of grass.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E29 The Score Is Even Lucas and Mark go on a hunting trip and soon become witnesses to a robbery and murder. Lucas subdues the two robbers, but is severely wounded in the process. Lucas struggles to get the robbers to justice, but devises a plan just in the nick of time.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E30 The Mescalero Curse Lucas serves as a jury foreman when a Mescalero Apache Indian is found guilty of murder and is hanged. A Mescalero medicine man places a curse on Lucas. At first Lucas brushes it off, then unusual events begin to happen including a ghost stallion.

programme.title: Ultimate Cowboy Showdown
programme.desc: S1 E3 Friendship the Hard Way With only eight cowboys left, the competition takes a dangerous turn as the contestants compete in a challenge with a raging bull to win the immunity belt buckle. Mayhem ensues, and one of the cowboys finds himself in a life-threatening situation. After a long talk, the two feuding cowboys realize the error or their ways and bury the hatchet. During the team challenge a steer escapes, and while most of the contestants try to correct their mistake, a few of them sit on the sidelines instead of helping their fellow teammates. Trace is left questioning their commitment to the competition. A female competitor refuses to criticize her teammates, which puts her in the hot seat and in danger of going home.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E10 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 1 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial “line in the sand.” South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this “dead line” with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that endangers the town’s beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E11 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 2 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial “line in the sand.” South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this “dead line” with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that ends the life of the town’s beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand. After tracking down her killer, Masterson shoots him in the arm as he tries to escape. When the judge learns there are no witnesses, however, he sets the killer free due to lack of evidence, leaving Masterson with a moral dilemma. Does he seek revenge or await the s

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E6 John Coffee Hays: A Texas Legend A Tennessee native, John Coffee Hays heads to the frontier of Texas in the 1830s and signs on as an early member of the Texas Rangers. In 1844, Hays becomes a legend when he leads a small band of rangers in a desperate fight with the Comanche.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S4 E7 John Mullan: Roadbuilder of the West Young Army officer John Mullan heads west to help establish an important wagon route through the Northern Rockies. But, before he can build his road, Mullan must survive the hardships of the frontier and a dangerous encounter with Yakima warriors.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E9 Bad Company Jimmy accidentally kills an innocent woman during a gunfight. Full of guilt, he goes to a lawless town, thinking that is where he should reside. The riders go after him to convince him that he doesn't belong there.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E19 And the Devil Makes Five While returning from a hunting trip, Lucas and Mark meet Marshal Micah Torrance who is escorting prisoner Scully Potter to trial. Later in camp, Lucas' life is suddenly in danger when a rattlesnake is found in his bedroll. Potter tries to escape.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E20 End of the Hunt Lucas wants to kill an old enemy, Reef Jackson, who is coming to North Fork. In the past, Jackson shot Lucas in the back and tried to steal his wife. Micah puts Lucas in jail to stop him from getting his revenge. Meanwhile, Mark wants to bag an elk.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E21 The Bullet While traveling, Lucas rescues a man named Griff, a corrupt gambling hall owner. When he reports Griff to the marshal, Lucas learns that a missing friend of his is dead and the marshal is using a new science called ballistics to solve the crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S5 E22 Requiem at Mission Springs Mark is paralyzed after falling off his horse. When Doc Burrage suggests that warm mineral baths could help him recover, Lucas and Lou take Mark to the old Mission Springs. However, danger lies ahead when escapees arrive.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E1 Winchester Quarantine Cheyenne meets a beautiful, feisty woman and helps her drive her herd of cattle to safety from a fever outbreak during a Texas quarantine. Despite her business struggles, he also finds himself falling in love with her.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S6 E2 Trouble Street When Cheyenne rides into a town, the deputy quickly arrests him for no apparent reason. He discovers that the corrupt deputy arrests others passing through town and forces them to work at a local mine.

programme.title: The Cowboy Way

programme.title: Catch 21

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Proficient in TV trivia? Can't get your fill of the latest in pop culture? This series combines both by opening the floor to a team of television aficionados, engaging them in a lively discussion regarding a classic TV topic, then counting down viewers' favorite shows and/or characters within that genre. There's a unique twist involved too.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Actor Alec Baldwin hosts - and executive produces - the newest iteration of the iconic panel game show in which four contestants try to match answers given by six celebrities to humorous and often risque fill-in-the-blank questions. The famous panelists range from quick-witted comics to stars of the stage and screen.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices, and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Jeopardy!

Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Two teams of three compete to complete a chain of words after the first and last words in the chain are revealed. The team that completes the most chains wins and advances to a bonus round to determine the amount of money won. Dylan Lane hosts.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Two teams of three compete to complete a chain of words after the first and last words in the chain are revealed. The team that completes the most chains wins and advances to a bonus round to determine the amount of money won. Dylan Lane hosts.

programme.title: Catch 21
programme.desc: Players must combine their trivia talent with card-counting skills to win at "Catch 21." Alfonso Ribiero hosts.

programme.title: Catch 21
programme.desc: Players must combine their trivia talent with card-counting skills to win at "Catch 21." Alfonso Ribiero hosts.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Switch

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices, and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. programme.desc: Mossad's Kidon unit's objective is to kill the enemies of Israel; the elite agents from this mysterious unit obey only the Israeli Prime Minister; questions regarding their assassination techniques and how they choose their targets.

programme.title: The John Glenn Story

programme.title: Surviving Hitler's Mad Doctors
programme.desc: The Nazi Regime imposed some of the most heinous forms of eugenics the world ever witnessed; Nazi concentration camps conducted so-called "medical research projects" involving cruel and often lethal experimentation on human subjects.
